derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin beneficiarius, from beneficium (see benefice)

entry.def: Someone who is a beneficiary of something is helped by it.

example.ex: The main beneficiaries of pension equality so far have been men.
example.tran: 迄今为止，退休金均等政策的主要受益者一直是男性。

entry.def: The beneficiaries of a will are legally entitled to receive money or property from someone when that person dies.

means.word_mean: 1. the recipient of funds or other benefits
2. the semantic role of the intended recipient who benefits from the happening denoted by the verb in the clause
1. having or arising from a benefice;
